intro: Conyza discolor, commonly known as the pale conyza, is an annual flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Conyza discolor is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
